com.fluidops.iwb.api.valueresolver

Class ValueResolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fluidops.util.ExtensibleEnumValue
      • com.fluidops.iwb.api.valueresolver.ValueResolver

  • public abstract class ValueResolver
extends com.fluidops.util.ExtensibleEnumValue

    The base class for all ValueResolvers. A ValueResolver is a light-weight module which converts a Value into some String representation.

    ValueResolvers are registered to the ValueResolverRegistry. There exist various built-in system value resolvers as defined in this class which are automatically initialized. Despite that it is possible to provide custom value resolvers as extensions using the Java SPI mechanisms.

    ValueResolvers must have a system-wide unique name used for identification in the ValueResolverRegistry. Note that the name must adhere to the naming rules of Java fields.

    Adding custom value resolvers

    The value resolver framework is designed with extensibility in mind, i.e., it is easily possible to register custom value resolvers either by code or using the Java ServiceLoader mechanism. As already mentioned, all value resolvers are registered to the singleton ValueResolverRegistry instance. This instance is initialized on startup with the built-in value resolvers as well as with extensions using the ServiceLoader mechanism.

    A custom value resolver can be created as follows:

    1. Create a new value resolver by extending the abstract ValueResolver class. It is recommended to also override the description() method.
    2. Implement a ValueResolverFactory which creates the ValueResolver instance.
    3. Add the entry for the ValueResolverFactory to a the classpath in META-INF such that it can be picked up by the ServiceLoader. In practice this means that you create (or extend) the file "META-INF/services/com.fluidops.iwb.api.valueresolver.ValueResolverFactory" in which the fully qualified classnames of the ValueResolverFactory are specified, one entry per line, e.g. com.fluidops.iwb.api.valueresolver.MyValueResolverFactory
    Author:
    as
    See Also:
    ValueResolverRegistry, ValueResolverFactory, ValueResolverUtil

      • PERCENT

        public static final java.lang.String PERCENT
        Converts a decimal number like '0.71356' to a percent value and appends a percent sign '71.36%'. This is useful as decimal numbers indicating, for example, the load factor of machine are often counterintuitive to the end-user.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PERCENT_NOCONVERT

        public static final java.lang.String PERCENT_NOCONVERT
        Rounds a number to two decimal places after comma and appends a percent sign. For example, it converts '71.356' to '71.36%'. This is useful if someone wants to display percent values labeled with the percent sign, for instance, in a QueryResultTable or BarChart.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ROUND_DOUBLE

        public static final java.lang.String ROUND_DOUBLE
        Round a number to two decimal places after comma

    • Method Detail

      • handle

        public abstract java.lang.String handle(org.openrdf.model.Value value)
        This method determines how the non-null Value is converted to a String representation. This method must not return
        Parameters:
        value - a non-null Value to convert
        Returns:
        a non-null String representation

      • handle

        public java.lang.String handle(java.util.List<org.openrdf.model.Value> values)
        This method determines how a List of value is converted to a string representation. Actual value resolvers may override the default functionality, which takes the first element of the list. If the list is empty of null, the handle(Value) is invoked for an empty string.
        Parameters:
        values -
        Returns:

      • description

        public java.lang.String description()
        Returns a textual description of the respective ValueResolver. By default this method returns its name.
        Returns:

      • resolveValue

        public static java.lang.String resolveValue(java.lang.String valueResolver,
                            org.openrdf.model.Value value)
        Resolve the given Value with the specified valueResolver. The valueResolver is looked up in the ValueResolverRegistry. For robustness this method resolves the value with the DEFAULT one if a) the provided valueResolver is b) the provided valueResolver is not known to the registry (warning is printed to the log) c) an error occurred in the requested ValueResolver (e.g. a conversion error). Information is printed to debug log. If a value is provided, the empty string is assumed as literal. The default resolver then show DefaultValueResolver#UNDEFINED.
        Parameters:
        valueResolver - a valueResolver name known to the ValueResolverRegistry
        value - a value (may be null>
        Returns:

      • resolveValues

        public static java.lang.String resolveValues(java.lang.String valueResolver,
                             java.util.List<org.openrdf.model.Value> values)
        Resolve the given list of Values with the specified valueResolver. The valueResolver is looked up in the ValueResolverRegistry. For robustness this method resolves the values with the DEFAULT one if a) the provided valueResolver is b) the provided valueResolver is not known to the registry (warning is printed to the log) c) an error occurred in the requested ValueResolver (e.g. a conversion error). Information is printed to debug log. Note that only some value resolvers actually override the default functionality of handle(List) in order deal with multiple values.
        Parameters:
        valueResolver - a valueResolver name known to the ValueResolverRegistry
        value - a list of values
        Returns:

      • getValueResolver

        public static ValueResolver getValueResolver(java.lang.String valueResolver)
        Looks up the given valueResolver in the ValueResolverRegistry and returns the found result. If the valueResolver is not known to the system, this method returns
        Parameters:
        valueResolver - a valueResolver name known to the ValueResolverRegistry
        Returns:
        a ValueResolver or
